summary: This document is an email chain from August 10, 2019, forwarding a draft press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death. The sender requests specific factual answers about the circumstances of Epstein's death, notification of next of kin, life-saving measures, transport to the hospital, FBI notification, and details of his charges and arrival at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email inquiry; questions are asked about the circumstances of his death, his charges, and his arrival at MCC NY.

events.title: Inquiry into Epstein's Death
events.description: An email is sent requesting specific details about the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody, including the time he was found, life-saving measures, transport to the hospital, and official notifications.

events.title: Draft Press Release Finalization
events.description: The sender states they are working with IPPA to finalize a draft press release regarding Epstein's death and are seeking factual answers to include.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at approximately 6:30 am on the date of the inquiry (August 10, 2019).
The email seeks confirmation on whether life-saving measures were initiated by staff and/or EMS, and whether Epstein was pronounced dead by EMS or hospital staff at 7:30 am.
The sender asks if the FBI was notified and if the death is being investigated as a suicide.
The document references Epstein's arrival at MCC NY on a 'PP37' and requests the specific offense titles for which he was indicted, noting the general news characterization as 'sex trafficking'.
